thread.title: Democrats seek to make up ground in Mississippi House as Republicans push for supermajority
thread.title_full: Democrats seek to make up ground in Mississippi House as Republicans push for supermajority

author: Staff of Y'all Politics
title: Democrats seek to make up ground in Mississippi House as Republicans push for supermajority
text: Democrats seek to make up ground in Mississippi House as Republicans push for supermajority Democrats say their goal is to retake the House majority, but they must upset a string of Republican incumbents to do that. Republicans say they're aiming for a supermajority of 74. That would remove a Democratic check on tax and spending bills, which require 60 percent of votes to pass. Arnold won office representing Prentiss and Alcorn counties in 2011. Now Democrat Lauren Childers, daughter of former U.S. Rep. Travis Childers, is challenging Arnold. After the primaries, 41 Republicans and 39 Democrats are unopposed. Republicans have incumbents in many more contested races, and all GOP incumbents have raised more money than their Democratic challengers. AP Posted October 2, 2015 - 7:03 am YallPolitics.Com now uses Facebook for comments. Log into Facebook to comment here.
